intro: Dortmanna scabra var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Dortmanna, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom in dense clusters. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly observed in the wild.
